citations.narrative:
The facility’s contingency plan is dated October 2022. An annual review has not been performed and documented since
October 2022. Contingency plans must be in place and reviewed annually to ensure it adequately addresses the criteria
listed in paragraph (a) of this section and is still relevant to the facility and animals. The plan must provide for the humane
handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct
by 6 August 2024 by reviewing the facility's contingency plan at least once a year and by maintaining documentation of
the review.

While walking through the outdoor dry lot pen area housing 295 goats and 5 sheep, two boards with exposed nails were
observed inside the enclosure laying on the ground. One of the boards was laying with the nails facing down and the
second board was laying with the tip of the nails pointing up. There are multiple long loose strands of twine on the ground
where the animals have direct access. Sharp points or edges and twine-like material that can be reached by the animals
can cause unnecessary injury and discomfort. Correct by 23 July 2024 by ensuring that all outdoor housing facilities are in
good repair and protect the animals from injury and contain them.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Rachel Perez-Baum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
